page.title: 09SPORT IN RHOOSE
page.content: Rhoose has always had a strong football tradition. The{Rhoose Social {Club}has always been involved with running a teams at Junior and Senior levels in both local and regional levels. Until two seasons ago the Club had a successful side in the South Wales Amateur League. The same organisation has worked hard at developing a thriving{Boxing Club which now attracts members from outside the confines of Rhoose itself. The other Social Club has been set up under the auspices of the Airport. It used to be called the Cambrian Club, then the British Airways Club. It is now known as the Cardiff Wales Airport Club. They too run teams in local leagues. The changes in name serve to reflect the changing fortunes of Trade and Industry in the area as companies come and,more frequently go.
